intro: Schradera condorica, commonly known as the Condorica schradera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, adapting well to high-altitude environments. Schradera condorica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
